newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ shares stage partial recovery to end firmer.
newsitem.headline: NZ shares stage partial recovery to end firmer.

text.p: * NZ shares end firmer but off highs
* Telecom rises, Fletcher Challenge stocks mainly struggle
* Volume high, boosted by Telecom warrants, Progressive
Price movements at close
LAST CHG
327 +1 * NZSC cap index +38.54 at 5,116.53
356 +2 * Volume NZ$124 million. Futures unch at 1,120
649 +4 * Other movers - +11 -7
New Zealand shares ended firmer but off their highs on Friday on another day of heavy volume.
The NZSE-40 capital index closed 5.15 points firmer at 2,279.33, with market leader Telecom up four cents at NZ$6.49.
Telecom bought back a further 1.4 million of its own shares at $6.49 and $6.50, and accounted for $41.3 million of the heavy market turnover of $124 million.
Telecom warrants and a line of four million shares at $1.47 in supermarket owner Progressive Enterprises were also substantial contributors to overall turnover.
Philip Hardie Boys at BZW said it was encouraging that the market was showing good depth, but it remained vulnerable to volatility from offshore.
"You've got U.S. interest rates still tracking up, and that doesn't help equity markets," said Sean Vaughan at County Natwest.

He said next Tuesday's Budget Policy Statement from the government would be watched for indications on where the centre-right coalition would focus its planned extra spending of NZ$5 million over three years, with implications for construction stocks such as Milburn and Fletcher
Building.

Vaughan expected some consolidation next week in the Fletcher Challenge stocks which, except for Building, all finished lower again in further reaction to this week's poorly-received first half results.
Brierley Investments and Sky City are also due to report half-year results next week.
